message.content:
cs.AI, cs.LO, cs.LG, cs.CL, cs.CC

This paper discusses the problem of defining a logic for analogical reasoning, which is a common topic in artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The proposed solution involves using semantics similar to those used for counterfactual conditionals, which falls under the category of logic in computer science (cs.LO). The paper also mentions preferential structures, which are commonly used in reasoning under uncertainty and non-monotonic reasoning (cs.LG). Additionally, the paper discusses the semantics of analogical reasoning, which is a topic in natural language processing and computational linguistics (cs.CL). Finally, the paper touches on the use of analogical reasoning in cognitive computing (cs.CC).
